author: M K
text:
With more than four months left for the famous annual flower show as part of the summer festival in Udhagamandalam, work has begun from the eve of New Year. The preparations are underway at the Italian Garden, New Garden, Lower Garden, Japanese Garden, and Top Garden.

While the number of flowers for display is the same (5 lakh) as last year, 194 varieties of flowers will be on display this season. This is 19 more than 175 varieties displayed for the festival in 2015.

Among them are 6,000 bulbs of tulips in six colours which would be on display for the first time during the summer festival. Joint Director of Horticulture N. Mani told The Hindu that tulip blooms only in the winter, and attempts were being made to make it bloom during early summer season.
title: Preparations begin for Ooty flower show
